ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] loading spell
ygData.msgSnippet: You can rename your ini file to include the new servername and then when you launch EQ it will have all your original configurations. If you have launched EQ
ygData.messageBody:
You can rename your ini file to include the new servername and then when you launch EQ it will have all your original configurations.
 
If you have launched EQ since the merger, there will be a default ini file named UI_charname_newservername.ini. Just delete this one (or rename it save_ or something if you don't want to delete it). Then find your old UI_charname_oldservername.ini and rename the oldservername section to the newservername.
Do the same thing to the charname_newservername.ini and an charname_oldservername.ini as well as bazaar and barter files you can rename to get all your old prices and stuffies.
 
Good luck!
Lilli
Steven Hulse <steveh@...> wrote:
You will have to recreate all your spell sets unfortunately. Once you do that if you left-click (?) on the spellbook icon it will bring up a little window where you can save your spellsets. I had to redo all of mine as well. The same goes for hotbuttons, you will have to recreate all of those as well.

The servers are bieng merged mostly due to the amount of players on each one. I was originally on Sol Ro and now on Bristlebane and on Sol Ro there were very few players there before the merge. Granted the decrease of lag in PoK and the bazaar was really nice but the lack of others to play with wasn't.

Hope that helps!
Durgaa Silveroak
